DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the type of ablation therapy.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Electromagnetic radiation between the ultrahigh frequency radio and infrared (in the 10e-3 (micro) to about 0.5 X 10e-1 meter) region of the spectrum.: Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Electromagnetic radiation between the ultrahigh frequency radio and infrared (in the 10e-3 (micro) to about 0.5 X 10e-1 meter) region of the spectrum.
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An injection of ethanol (alcohol) through the skin directly into a tumor to kill cancer cells. Ultrasound or a CT scan is used to guide the needle into the tumor.

Concepts.definition: An injection of ethanol (alcohol) through the skin directly into a tumor to kill cancer cells. Ultrasound or a CT scan is used to guide the needle into the tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiation therapy technique that delivers radiation directly to the tumor while sparing the healthy tissue. Also called radiation surgery and stereotactic external beam irradiation.: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to treat cancer cells that use high energy beams.
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure to eradicate or reduce small tumors using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of a thin needle through the skin and into a tumor, which is guided by computed tomography (CT) or ultrasound. Electrical energy delivered through this needle (electrode) heats and destroys the tumor. This therapeutic option is widely utilized by patients that have inoperable cancers, or are unsuitable chemotherapy candidates.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure to kill tissue using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of an electrode into a target tissue. Electrical energy delivered to the electrode heats and destroys the tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The therapeutic use of cold or refrigeration in medicine.

Concepts.definition: The therapeutic use of cold or refrigeration in medicine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-thermal ablation modality that is used in the treatment of locally advanced soft tissue tumors. This technique uses ultra-short, but strong, electrical fields to create permanent, lethal nanopores in cell membranes, disrupting cellular homeostasis and causing cell death. The technique may be performed intraoperatively, laparoscopically, or percutaneously.

Concepts.definition: A non-thermal ablation modality that is used in the treatment of locally advanced soft tissue tumors. This technique uses ultra-short, but strong, electrical fields to create permanent, lethal nanopores in cell membranes, disrupting cellular homeostasis and causing cell death. The technique may be performed intraoperatively, laparoscopically, or percutaneously.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Percutaneous Route of Administration Ablation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Percutaneous Route of Administration Ablation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Administration through the skin.: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug by the way of absorption through the skin, usually for systemic action. The route allows sustained therapeutic plasma drug levels and avoids first pass effect. Simplicity of administration tends to result in high patient compliance.
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Therapeutic blockage of an artery by a clot of foreign material.

Concepts.definition: Therapeutic blockage of an artery by a clot of foreign material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Concepts.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.
